docs.snippet: A report, on emergency agencies’ ability to communicate in a disaster, gave the lowest scores to Chicago; Baton Rouge, La.; Cleveland; Mandan, N.D.; and American Samoa....
docs.lead_paragraph: A report, on emergency agencies’ ability to communicate in a disaster, gave the lowest scores to Chicago; Baton Rouge, La.; Cleveland; Mandan, N.D.; and American Samoa.

headline.print_headline: Few Get Top Federal Marks for Disaster Planning
headline.main: Few Get Top Federal Marks for Disaster Planning

docs.snippet: The grants, awarded to two groups, are intended to be used to improve the way charitable groups respond to disasters....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hoping to improve the way charitable groups handle their disaster responses, Microsoft is donating $41 million in software and cash to two groups of humanitarian agencies to foster collaboration and communication. The grants will be used to upgrade technology systems that have been pieced together over decades, assess the groups' technology needs and create forums online so they can exchange information and work on problems together.

headline.main: Grants Given By Microsoft For Relief Aid

docs.snippet: An unprecedented demand for its services has depleted American Red Cross disaster reserve funds to absolute zero, the organization's national chairman said today....
docs.abstract: ARC chmn Dr F Stanton asserts on June 4 that an unprecedented demand for orgn's services has depleted ARC disaster reserve funds to 'absolute zero,' address to opening session of 48th natl Red Cross conv; holds $33-million has been distributed in last 10 mos, primarily to flood victims; at preconv meeting, resolutions com rejected several proposals to establish fee schedule to offset cost of Red Cross services
docs.lead_paragraph: An unprecedented demand for its services has depleted American Red Cross disaster reserve funds to absolute zero, the organization's national chairman said today.

headline.main: RED CROSS PUTS RESERVES AT ZERO; Chairman Reports Disasters Have Used Up All Funds No Substitutes

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 -- The civil war in Nigeria has given an American "packaged disaster hospital" its first test under the conditions for which the self-contained units were originally conceived....
docs.abstract: Amer packaged disaster hosp, designed to supply needs of communities devastated by nuclear war or natural disaster, containing everything, short of bldg shell, necessary to set up 200-bed hosp operates successfully in Nigerian civil war

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr.Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 -- The civil war in Nigeria has given an American "packaged disaster hospital" its first test under the conditions for which the self-contained units were originally conceived.

headline.main: ' Packaged' U.S. Hospital Passes Test in Nigeria; Self-Contained Disaster Unit, Deployed at Port Harcourt, Proves to Be Functional

docs.snippet: Senator Lehman deserves public support for his forthright efforts to get the Federal Government to come to grips with the problems of disaster relief. It is he who has sparked the hearings on the subject by the Senate Banking and Currency Committe...
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Lehman deserves public support for his forthright efforts to get the Federal Government to come to grips with the problems of disaster relief. It is he who has sparked the hearings on the subject by the Senate Banking and Currency Committee.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 31 -- The Senate Banking and Currency Committee today began examining proposals for disaster insurance. Plans to insure, with Government help, home owners, businesses and farmers against severe losses from such disasters as floods...
docs.abstract: Sen (Lehman) com opens hearings on Fed disaster ins plans, Washington; Asst Budget Dir Jones offers Adm plan based on 3-yr experimental program with ins ltd to $250,000-350,000 for individuals or cos; other Adm proposals; Lehman disappointed; calls proposals too gen; chides Adm for not preparing comprehensive program for study
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 31 -- The Senate Banking and Currency Committee today began examining proposals for disaster insurance. Plans to insure, with Government help, home owners, businesses and farmers against severe losses from such disasters as floods, military attacks and smogs, are to be investigated.

headline.main: TEST OF INSURANCE IN DISASTER ASKED; Administration Aide Urges Three-Year Program at Senate Unit Hearings

docs.snippet: LANSING, Mich., Dec. 31 (AP) -- Dr. Charles A. Laughead, the former Michigan State College physician who was discharged for predicting world doom, was found sane in an Ingham County probate court hearing today....
docs.abstract: Sister's petition to have him declared insane dismissed by probate ct, Lansing, Mich
docs.lead_paragraph: LANSING, Mich., Dec. 31 (AP) -- Dr. Charles A. Laughead, the former Michigan State College physician who was discharged for predicting world doom, was found sane in an Ingham County probate court hearing today.

headline.main: DOOM-CULTIST HELD SANE; Doctors Call Ideas 'Unusual,' but Deny Laughead Is Ill

docs.snippet: LANSING, Mich., Dec. 22 (AP) -- A sister of Dr. Charles Laughead, former Michigan State College physician, today petitioned the courts to declare him and his wife, Lillian, mentally ill....
docs.abstract: his sister asks cts to declare him and wife mentally ill
docs.lead_paragraph: LANSING, Mich., Dec. 22 (AP) -- A sister of Dr. Charles Laughead, former Michigan State College physician, today petitioned the courts to declare him and his wife, Lillian, mentally ill.

headline.main: DR. LAUGHEAD CALLED ILL; Sister Asks He Be Confined as a Mental Patient

docs.snippet: When the 1936 Republican platform was adopted it was immediately evident that the edge had been taken off the most active of the pre-convention accusations against the President -- that he had reversed many major pledges in the Democratic platform...
docs.lead_paragraph: When the 1936 Republican platform was adopted it was immediately evident that the edge had been taken off the most active of the pre-convention accusations against the President -- that he had reversed many major pledges in the Democratic platform on which he was elected.

headline.main: In The Nation; A Proposed Test of Real Inconsistency
